G   TA  INNATE POWERS UPDATE

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 

GOTA

 
 
OUT NOW

 
 
 

 
 
INNATE POWERS UPDATE
 
 
This patch is more than ambitious.
 
The following segments will attempt to summarize and highlights the key changes.

GENERAL CHANGES

Something not mentioned here is that the map has also been reworked, but that is a given in any good patch.
Side Shops Return
Quirt and Sithil return to business after a long hiatus; however, due to the hard times, their stock amount is even more limited than before, only selling components that are not more expensive than 400 gold.
 
Make sure to pay a visit to them on the side lanes between the radiant and dire tier 1 towers, where they previously conducted business.
Rune System Reworked
There are now two rune categories: Power Runes and Utility Runes.
 
Power Runes additionally split into two sub-categories: Offensive Power and Defensive Power Runes.
 
Power Runes spawn in the top-side and bot-side of the river every four minutes, starting at minute 4. If an Offensive Power Rune spawns on the top-side, then a Defensive Power Rune will spawn on the bot-side.
 
Utility Runes spawn in the main jungle of both sides every 2 minutes, starting at minute 2. The first and every third Utility Rune will always be a Bounty Rune.
 
To find out more about the Rune system and the list of Runes, keep scrolling.
Debuff Immunity reworked
Debuff Immunity has been reworked into Magic Immunity to be more understandable and systematic, both function-wise and naming-wise.
 
Magic Immunity is made up of two components:
 
Magic Resistance. Works the same way as before, decreases the magic damage dealt to you by a percentage. When this percentage is 100%, we can also refer to it as Magic Damage Immunity.
 
Debuff Resistance. This one simply reduces the duration of debuffs by a percentage. When this percentage is 100%, we can also refer to it as Debuff Immunity.
 
Debuff Immunity and Magic Damage Immunity, when combined is what we call Magic Immunity. In this state, while abilities can target you, they won't deal damage and their debuffs immediately end without ever affecting you. Well, unless they pierce Magic Immunity.
 
Note two important differences between the previous and current systems.
 
Neither Debuff Immunity nor Magic Damage Immunity blocks physical ability damage, reflected damage, or pure damage now, leaving you vulnerable to these sources of damage while you are Magic Immune.
 
Also, since Debuff Resistance and Debuff Immunity are now the same mechanic, abilities that pierce Debuff Immunity now also pierce Debuff Resistance.
Economy Updates
Events that include enemy heroes and structures now provide reliable gold, while your base gold per minute and other passive sources of gold now provide unreliable gold to make risk-taking more rewarding. Additionally, neutral creep economy is now dynamic, meaning that the gold and experience bounty of neutral creeps change constantly throughout the game.
Hero Kill Formula Reworked
When you are killed, it is only your own net worth and current level that matter now. Kills no longer have a base bounty or a team networth factor; also, the hero kill assist formula is directly tied to the hero kill formula now, making the received bounties more consistent and logical.
Roshan Updates
Killing Roshan is harder than ever, but also ever so rewarding. When Roshan is killed, the next 3 creepwaves that spawn will consist of mega creeps and a catapult, making the highground siege with the Aegis of the Immortal a lot easier than before. Also, the rewards for killing Roshan are a bit different as well.

HERO changes

The hero class has undergone quite a number of exciting changes.
New Hero Class: Style
These heroes allow the players to build them however they want, depending on their playstyle, by having a fluid primary attribute. The primary attribute is determined by which attribute the hero has the most of. For example, a hero like Pangolier, who gains more agility than strength, can be turned into a strength hero by buying items that give strength.
INNATE ABILITIES
Every hero has an innate ability now.
 
These passive and active abilities differ from being a useful tool early on to being a game-changing late-game ability to abuse. They also differ in leveling: some can be leveled, while others cannot.
 
A few of these innate abilities will be familiar, for example, Invoker's Invoke or Earth Spirit's Stone Remnants; however, others, like Chaotic Luck or Black Grimoire, will probably not be.
OLD KING RETURNS
King Leoric is back from his ceremony, ready to extend his reach once again.
 
With a kit of reworked abilities and a new innate ability to help him fit in, he surely won't have any problem dealing with heroes who oppose him.
 
Welcome back, King Leoric.
HERO CLASS BENEFITS
Heroes now gain class specific perks, depending on their primary attribute. Strength heroes gain bonus damage block per strength, agility heroes gain bonus movement speed per agility, and intelligence heroes gain cooldown reduction per intelligence, while universal heroes enjoy the perks of every class without any downsides.
CREEP-HERO SCALING
Creep-Heroes are now even more similar to heroes. They are now treated by every ability in the game as heroes, and are capable of leveling up. They level-up when their owner levels up and gain 4 bonus attack damage and 0.8 bonus armor with each level.
Universal Hero Pool Reworked
The entire universal hero roster has been changed, and their number has been decreased from 32 available heroes to only a select few. These heroes are Void Spirit, Enigma, Faceless Void, Chaos Knight, Keeper of the Light, IO, Elder Titan, and Weaver.

INNATE ABILITIES

As mentioned in the previous segment, every hero has an innate ability now. This section will show some examples.
ROTTING BODY
Undying's body is constantly rotting away, passively losing 5 health per second.
 
Undying's attacks spread this rot to enemy units, slowing them by 15% and dealing 15 damage per second.
DARKNESS COMES
Night Stalker shifts the day-night cycle, starting the cycle with night first, as well as drawing out the night sooner than expected, making the daytime 30 seconds shorter.
 
Each subsequent day is even shorter by an additional 30 seconds, eventually leading to a permanent night.
THUNDERGOD'S WRATH
When activated, Zeus strikes every enemy hero, no matter where they may be, with the current level of Lightning Bolt, dealing damage, stunning them, and providing True Sight vision over them.
 
Mana Cost: 300
Cooldown: 160s
Aura of Honor
Sven's honorable acts inspire allied heroes in a 1200-radius, passively granting them 5 bonus armor.
Beast Companion
Beastmaster chooses a non-ancient savage beast of any level to take his side in the battles to come.
 
Beastmaster loses 300 health when the beast dies.
 
Cooldown: 60s
PARRY
Juggernaut has a 15% chance to block attacks within a 400-range and counterattack when he can.
Sidekick
Marci's loyalty helps ensure survival, imbuing a chosen allied hero with 20 bonus attack damage, and healing this allied hero by 50% of the damage dealt to enemy heroes by her.
 
Sidekick is removed when the chosen allied hero and Marci drift 2400 units apart from each other.
 
Mana Cost: 25
Cooldown: 60s
Battleforged Skin
Axe's red-blooded body prevents enemy heroes from lifestealing off of him.
Chaotic Luck
Chaos Knight's chance to proc his abilities and items is set to a flat 50% for 6 seconds.
 
Cooldown: 30s

THE GRAVEYARD

Not everything can stay in the game forever. This segment will show some that did not escape the culling blade this patch.
The very first concept removed as a design choice was the talent system.
 
The two main problems with the talent system in particular are that it takes every creative quirk that you could give to a hero, as well as being the greatest offender when it comes to power creep.
 
You don't want boring talents that just give +20 damage or -2 second cooldown, but if you make creative talents, then you are either throwing away creative ideas that could be implemented as a base mechanic for the hero or contributing to power creep.
 
Basically, the trade-off here is that players get heroes with more interesting hero toolkits and less power crept numbers in exchange for the talent system. It should not be too bad of a trade.
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
But that is not all.
 
Neutral Items have also been removed.
Neutral Items also suffer from the same problems as talents but with an added spin - they are kind of just pointless.
 
With talents, at least they are interesting but neutral items.. not so much.
 
Even now, with the tokens change, it is still just pointless RNG and power creep wrapped up in one package.
The following structures have also been removed:
 
Outposts
 
 
When Outposts were introduced, they used to give tons of experience, which, understandably, was not very enjoyable to play around.
 
A huge part of the charm of DotA is that it gives you creative freedom and allows you to play the game however you want to.
 
With their sole purpose of granting experience stripped, Outposts simply became glorified teleport spots, which is something that is not necessary on the current map; therefore, they are removed.
Tormentors
 
 
 
Tormentors are honestly just not memorable.
 
While they definitely have a decent impact on the game, they just feel redundant and are a chore to take down.
 
They are probably the least necessary structure in the whole game, and as a result, they are removed.
Watchers
 
 
 
 
The services of the small free observer wards, also known as Watchers, are no longer necessary with the map scaled back to a degree.
 
They will be remembered.
Moving on to the list of removed and replaced items:
Blood Grenade
Cornucopia
PHYLACTERY
METEOR HAMMER
Hurricane Pike
Nullifier
Helm of the Overlord
Disperser
Gleipnir
Aghanim's Blessing
But most importantly..
 

FAREWELL,
WRAITH KING.

 
 

GAMEPLAY PATCH

 

1.00

 
 
 
 
MAP REWORKED
MAP UPDATES
Map reworked. To clearly see every change, it is recommended to load-up the game.
 
Some noteable updates:
 
Map is now smaller but about 10% bigger than the pre-7.33, with the majority of the extra space being around the Roshan Pits located at the top-left and bottom-right corners.
 
Compared to the 7.32 map, there are 2-2 more neutral camps on each side, both of which are located around the Roshan Pits, and 1-1 more ancient-camps located around the Twin Gates.
 
Twin Gates were moved to the location where the Tormentors used to be. They do not require to be channeled anymore; the teleporting is instant; however, they place a dispellable debuff on the teleported units that silences and mutes them for 4 seconds. Twin Gates still cannot be used while the user is silenced.
 
Neutral camps were relocated, and new paths have been added to discover while navigating inside the forests.
 
Mid lane is now wider and the tier 1 towers are further away from the river.
 
DYNAMIC REWARDS
ECONOMY UPDATES
Base GPM increased from 90 to 100. This amount no longer increases as the game progresses.Previously increased up to 150 per minute.
 
 
The following events now grant reliable gold:
 
Roshan Death
Hero Death
Structure Destruction
Alchemist: Greevil's Greed
Bounty Hunter: Track
Hand of Midas: Transmute
 
The following events now grant unreliable gold:
 
Bounty Runes
Passive GPM
 
Offlane waves now have an additional melee creep every second wave.
 
Neutral creep experience and gold rewards are now dynamic. Works the following way:
 
Neutral creeps now grant 30% bonus gold and experience at the beginning of the game, but then grant 10% less every 5 minutes for 15 minutes.
 
After 15 minutes have passed, the effect gets reversed, and neutral creeps start granting 10% more gold and experience every 5 minutes for 15 minutes.
 
After another 15 minutes have passed, the effect gets reversed again, and neutrals creeps start granting 10% less every 5 minutes for 15 minutes. And repeat.

  Talisman of Evasion

  Recipes
HEALING LOTUS SPAWNING REWORKED
LOTUS POOL UPDATES
Lotus Pools were moved to the center of the primary jungles.
 
Healing Lotus spawning reworked.
 
Healing Lotuses now spawn around the Lotus Pool ready to be picked up every 2 minutes.
 
Lotus Pools now can be channeled to instantly restore 50 health and 100 mana. Once channeled, they dry up and go on cooldown for 3 minutes. While it is on cooldown, the Healing Lotus spawning is delayed and temporarily stopped. If the channeler has a Bottle, then it will be filled with a Water Rune.
 
RUNE SYSTEM REWORKED
Rune UPDATES
Rune system has been reworked into the following:
 
There are now 3 categories that each Rune belongs to:
 
Offensive Power Runes
Defensive Power Runes
Utility Runes
 
Offensive Power Runes and Defensive Power Runes spawn at the previous power Rune spots, on both sides of the river every four minutes, starting at minute 4.
 
Both an Offensive Power Rune and Defensive Power Rune spawns at this interval and if an Offensive Power Rune spawned on the top-side, then a Defensive Power Rune will spawn on the bot-side.
 
Offensive and Defensive Power Runes refill three Bottle charges.
 
List of Offensive Power Runes:
 
Double Damage Rune
Magic Damage Amplification Rune NEW  
 
List of Defensive Power Runes:
 
Armor Rune NEW  
Magic Resistance Rune NEW  
 
Utility Runes spawn in the main jungle of both sides every two minutes, starting at minute 2.
 
The first Utility Rune that spawns after the horn, and every third will always be a Bounty Rune.
 
Utility Runes only refill two Bottle charges.
 
List of Utility Runes:
 
Bounty Rune
Illusion Rune
Regeneration Rune
Haste Rune
Arcane Rune
 
New Rune: Magic Damage Amplification.
 
Grants 25% bonus magic damage amplification for 40 seconds.
 
New Rune: Armor.
 
Grants 20 bonus armor for 40 seconds.
 
New Rune: Magic Resistance.
 
Grants 30% bonus magic resistance for 40 seconds.
 
Bounty Runes reworked.
 
Bounty Runes now grant 75 gold and experience to the hero who picks them up. The gold and experience reward is increased by 15 every two minutes.
 
Water Runes no longer spawn. They can only be acquired through Lotus Pools.
 
Shield Rune removed.
 
Wisdom Rune removed.
 
CREEP SCALING REWORKED
CREEP UPDATES
Neutral creep scaling reworked.
 
Neutral Creeps now gain a level every 4 minutes. When they level up, they gain 4 bonus attack damage and 0.8 bonus armor. Their levels can be viewed at the same location as hero levels.
 
When a creep is dominated, it instead levels up every time its owner levels up.
 
Mega creeps now spawn with 4 bonus damage and 0.5 bonus armor per consecutive wave.
 
Ancient creeps levels increased:
 
Small ancient creep levels increased from 3 to 8.
Big ancient creep levels increased from 6 to 10.
 
Ancient creeps now have Magic Damage Immunity.
 
Flagbearer Creeps reworked.
 
Flagbearer Creeps now only spawn on the mid-lane and grant 200% of the experience of a melee creep when killed.
 
Inspirational Aura now grants 15% bonus movement speed in a 1200 radius to allied units instead of bonus health regeneration.
 
Lane creeps no longer move faster during night-time.
 
Creep experience penalty when denied increased from 50% to 75%.
 
roshan rewards reworked
ROSHAN UPDATES
Roshan no longer uses Twin Gates to travel between his pits. He now uses an underground cave system, which is inaccessible by heroes, to travel to the other pit. How he dug this cave system and gets to the other side so quickly will remain a trade secret.
 
Roshan base attribute updates:
 
Roshan now has debuff immunity
Roshan base health increased from 6000 to 9000
Roshan base health regeneration increased from 20 to 30
 
Roshan rewards reworked.
 
Killing Roshan now upgrades the next three waves to mega creep waves with catapults.
 
Roshan now drops the same rewards on both sides:
 
First death: Aegis of the Immortal
Second death: Aegis of the Immortal + Slice of CheeseWhen consumed, restores 1250 health and 750 mana.
Third death: Aegis of the Immortal + Cheese + Tome of AghanimRumors say reading this tome allows the reader to use their Aghanim's Scepter upgrade for 5 minutes.
Fourth death: Aegis of the Immortal + Block of Cheese + Infused Aghanim's ScepterPreviously called Aghanim's Blessing.
 
Roshan respawn interval decreased from 8-11 minutes to 8-10 minutes.
 
NEW HERO CLASS
INNATE ABILITIES
HERO CLASS UPDATES
There are now class specific benefits that heroes gain depending on their primary attribute:
 
Strength heroes now gain 0.35 damage block per strength.The chance to block is 50% and works on ranged heroes too.
 
 
Agility heroes now gain 0.07% movement speed per agility.
 
Intelligence heroes now gain 0.06% cooldown reduction per intelligence.
 
Heroes now have their own innate abilities.
 
These passive and active abilities differ from being a useful tool early on to being a game-changing late-game ability to abuse. They also differ in leveling: some can be leveled, while others cannot. A few of these innate abilities will be familiar, for example, Invoker's Invoke or Earth Spirit's Stone Remnants; however, others, like Chaotic Luck or Black Grimoire, will probably not be.
 
New Hero Class Type: Style.
 
These heroes allow the players to build them however they want, depending on their playstyle, by having a fluid primary attribute. The primary attribute is determined by which attribute the hero has the most of. For example, a hero like Pangolier, who gains more agility than strength, can be turned into a strength hero by buying items that give strength.
 
Universal Heroes reworked.
 
Hero pool reduced from 34 to 8. These heroes are now Void Spirit, Enigma, Faceless Void, Chaos Knight, Keeper of the Light, IO, Elder Titan, and Weaver.
 
Universal Heroes now fully benefit from every attribute's bonus perks, such as damage block per strength, movement speed per agility, and cooldown reduction per intelligence.
 
Universal Hero damage gain per stat reduced from 0.7 to 0.5.
 
Creep-Heroes reworked.
 
Creep-Heroes are now even more similar to heroes. They are now treated by every ability in the game as heroes, and are capable of leveling up. They level-up when their owner levels up and gain 4 bonus attack damage and 0.8 bonus armor with each level.
 
Heroes no longer move faster during night-time. Heroes and their summons are now granted a 25 bonus movement speed buff if they are traversing through the enemy side of the map.
 
Heroes no longer get a free Teleport Scroll upon death.
 
Innate damage block for melee heroes is removed.
 
Maximum Level decreased from 30 to 25.
 
FORMULAS REWORKED
HERO KILL UPDATES
Hero Kill Gold Formula reworked:
 
OLD   HeroBounty = 125 + (DeadHeroLevel x 8) + StreakGold
 
NEW   HeroBounty = 2 x [ 2 x (DeadHeroLevel + 0.01 x DeadHeroNetworth) + StreakGold
 
AoE Assist Gold Formula reworked:
 
OLD   AssistGold = (30 + VictimNetWorth x 0.038) x NetWorthDifferenceFactor / NumberOfHeroes
 
NEW   AssistGold = [(HeroBounty - StreakGold) / 2] / NumberOfHeroes
 
First Blood now also grants 100 bonus experience
 
new modifier
GLYPH REWORKED
STRUCTURE UPDATES
Glyph of Fortification reworked.
 
Now grants 100% damage reduction to allied structures for 20 seconds. The damage reduction gradually decreases over the duration.
 
Tower Protection Aura reworked.
 
Previously granted bonus armor and health regeneration to allied units in a 900-radius. Now grants 5 bonus armor to allied units that are being attacked for 3 seconds in a 900-radius.
 
Structures upon destruction now grant Momentum Surge buff to enemy creeps within 1200-radius.
 
Momentum Surge grants 10% bonus movement speed and 40 bonus attack speed for 10 seconds.
 
Tier 1 Tower attack range increased from 700 to 800.
 
NEW ABILITY TYPE
ABILITY TYPE UPDATES
New Ability Type: Semi-Ultimate.
 
These abilities can be leveled up at level 4 and then again every four levels, up to a maximum of four times.
 
Some noteable examples:
 
Divided We Stand
Invoke
Proximity Mines
 
Passive abilities in the ultimate ability-slot are no longer affected by Break.
 
 
NEW DAMAGE TYPE
DAMAGE TYPE UPDATES
New Damage Type: Dominated.
 
Creeps set under control permanently by Helm of The Dominator or a summon hero like Chen now gain this damage type. Units with this damage type deal 200% damage to heroes, 100% to creeps and 50% to structures.
 
Pure Damage now pierces Magic Immunity.
 
Reflected Damage now pierces Magic Immunity.
 
The following creep damage types saw a multitude of value changes:
 
Runty damage penalty against fortified armor type increased 30% to 50%.
 
Pierce damage penalty against fortified armor type increased from 65% to 75%.
 
Pierce damage penalty against hero armor type decreased from 50% to 25%.
 
Pierce damage increase against basic armor type increased from 50% to 100%.
 
Siege damage increase against fortified armor type increased from 150% to 200%.
 
Siege damage penalty against hero armor type increased from 0% to 25%.
 
Siege damage penalty against basic armor type increased from 0% to 50%.
 
 
primary attribute perks
ATTRIBUTE UPDATES
Attribute general perks are now increased by 20% if the attribute is the primary attribute of the hero, while Universal Heroes always benefit 10% more from the general perks of every attribute.
 
Strength:
 
Bonus health per strength decreased from 22 to 18.
 
Agility:
 
Bonus armor per agility decreased from 0.167 to 0.143.
 
Intelligence:
 
No longer grants 0.1% magic resistance.
Bonus mana per intelligence decreased from 12 to 9.
 
 
 
new state
new mechanics
STATE AND MECHANIC UPDATES
Spell Damage Reduction removed.
 
Spell Damage Amplification reworked into Magic Damage Amplification. Magic Damage Amplification does not increase pure and physical ability damage.
 
Spell Lifesteal reworked into Magic Lifesteal. Magic Lifesteal does not heal from pure and physical ability damage.
 
Magic Lifesteal now has a 400 range buffer. When dealing magic damage outside of this range, it now only heals for 50% of the value.
 
Lifesteal reworked.
 
Lifesteal now has a 400-range buffer. When dealing attack damage outside of this range, it now only heals for 50% of the value.
 
Lifesteal no longer has a creep penalty.
 
Damage Block now has a 400-range buffer. When taking attack damage outside of this range, it no longer mitigates attack damage.
 
Hex reworked. Now has two versions:
 
Breaking Hex. Transforms a unit into a sheep, removing its secondary attributes, for example, magic resistance, evasion, and magic lifesteal.
 
Slowing Hex. Transforms a unit into a frog, decreasing its movement speed to 100. This unit's movement speed cannot be increased while transformed.
 
New State: Paralyze.
 
Paralyzed units are forbidden from casting spells and attacking but can use items. This state is dispelled by any kind of forced movement.
 
Some noteable examples:
 
Paralyzing Cask
Frostbite
Frost Arrows
 
Uphill Miss Chance reworked.
 
The miss chance is now dependent on the level difference between the two units, allowing a maximum of 75% miss chance when there is a three-level difference.
 
Break now can always be dispelled and does not get applied on abilities that are in the ultimate-ability slot.
 
Flying units now elevate from the ground by 190 units, preventing units with a shorter attack range from attacking them and gaining highground advantage miss chance against ranged attackers.
 
Backpack items are no longer visible to enemy units.
 
Aura effects no longer have a linger duration.
 
Experience Acquisition range decreased from 1500 to 1200
 
 
debuff immunity reworked
DEBUFF IMMUNITY UPDATES
Debuff Immunity has been reworked into Magic Immunity.
 
Magic Immunity consists of two components:
 
Debuff Resistance. Reduces the duration of debuffs by a percentage. When this percentage is 100%, it can also be referred to as Debuff Immunity.
 
Magic Resistance. Works the same way as before, decreases the magic damage dealt to you by a percentage. When this percentage is 100%, it can also be referred to as Magic Immunity.
 
Debuff Immunity and Magic Damage Immunity, when combined is what we call Magic Immunity. In this state, while abilities can target you, they won't deal damage and their debuffs immediately end without ever affecting you. The only exception to this is if the ability pierces Magic Immunity.
 
Two noteable differences:
 
Neither Debuff Immunity nor Magic Immunity blocks physical damage, reflected damage, or pure damage now, leaving you vulnerable to these sources of damage.
 
Debuff Resistance and Debuff Immunity are now the same mechanic, therefore abilities that pierce Debuff Immunity now also pierce Debuff Resistance.
 
MAJOR REMOVALS
THE GRAVEYARD
The following concepts, structures, and heroes have been removed:
 
Talents.
 
Neutral Items.
 
Outposts.
 
Tormentors.
 
Watchers.
 
Wraith King.

MANA BREAK 
ABILITY REWORKED
 
Anti-Mage's attacks burn mana and deal damage equal to 50% of the mana burned.
